page.title: South Africa national under-23 football team

Football Association]] | Confederation = [[Confederation of African Football|CAF]] ([[Africa]]) | Sub-confederation = [[COSAFA]] | Coach = [[Ephraim Mashaba]] | Captain = | Most caps = | Top scorer = | Home Stadium = | FIFA Rank = | FIFA max = | FIFA max date = | FIFA min = | FIFA min date = | Elo Rank = | Elo max = | Elo max date = | Elo min = | Elo min date = | pattern_la1=_rsa10h|pattern_b1=_rsa10h|pattern_ra1=_rsa10h|pattern_sh1=_esp_08| leftarm1=019585|body1=019585|rightarm1=019585|shorts1=008000|socks1=F7EB29| pattern_la2=_rsa10a|pattern_b2=_rsa10a|pattern_ra2=_rsa10a|pattern_sh2=_rsa10a| leftarm2=019585|body2=019585|rightarm2=019585|shorts2=F7EB29|socks2=008000| First game ={{flagu|South Africa}} 0â0 {{fbu-rt|23|Ghana}}{{cite web|title=Under-23 National Team|url=http://www.safa.net/index.php?page=sau23|accessdate=30 December 2010}} | Largest win = | Largest loss = | Regional name = [[Football at the Summer Olympics|Olympic Games]] | Regional cup apps = 1 | Regional cup first = [[Football at the 2000 Summer Olympics|2000]] | Regional cup best = Group Stage [[Football at the 2000 Summer Olympics|2000]] | 2ndRegional name = [[Football at the All-Africa Games|All-Africa Games]] | 2ndRegional cup apps = 4 | 2ndRegional cup first = [[1999 All-Africa Games|1999]] | 2ndRegional cup best = Runner up, [[Football at the 2011 All-Africa Games â Men's tournament|2011]]| }} The South Africa national under-23 football team is a youth [[association football|football (soccer)]] team, which represents [[South Africa]] and is controlled by the [[South African Football Association]], the governing body for [[football in South Africa]]. The team's main objectives are to qualify and play at the [[Football at the All-Africa Games|All-Africa Games]] and [[Football at the Summer Olympics|Olympic Games]]. The team has played at three All-Africa Games and one Olympic tournement. ==History== The team was started in 1994, when [[South African Football Association|SAFA]] decided to form a youth team. The team has been sponsored by [[Sasol|SASOL]] since its inception, leading to the nickname, 'Amaglug-glug'. The team's greatest achievements to date include a third place finish at the [[1999 All-Africa Games]], hosted in [[South Africa]] and qualifying for the [[Football at the 2000 Summer Olympics|2000 Olympics]] in [[Sydney]], [[Australia]]. ==Player eligiblity== Players who are selected, will be 23 or younger in the following Olympic year. With the next [[Summer Olympic Games|Olympics]] being held in [[London]] in [[2012 Summer Olympics|2012]], players need to born on or after 1 January 1989. At the [[Football at the Summer Olympics|Olympic finals tournement]], the team may be supplemented with 3 over-age players.http://www.fifa.com/mm/document/tournament/competition/01/33/73/30/regulationsoft2012_update10.15.10_e.pdf ==Recent and future matches== Recent results {| class="wikitable" |- !
